CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 3, 1962, pg. 14A, reads: "Alberta Thompson, well known amateur model, wore an elegant French import with an all-flowered hat." For "Melody in Fashion" benefit for MENDS.Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 9, 1962, pg. 11, reads: "TO CONDUCT CLINIC - Lovely Alberta Thompson, one of Pittsburgh;s most popular models, will conduct a charm clinic and fashion show for the beauticians at their annual state convention, at Myrtle Beach, S. C., June 10-13.  Miss Thompson is with the Marlene Moore Model Agency in Pittsburgh. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Alberta Thompson, wearing dress with pleated skirt and pocket, light colored gloves, and tall floral hat, standing in front of musicians in Holiday House for D.I.'s "Melody in Fashions" benefit
CatSubject_tab: Clothing and dress--Pennsylvania--Monroeville.Women--Pennsylvania--Monroeville.Delightfully Insane Club Inc.Holiday House (Monroeville, Pa).Charities--Pennsylvania--Monroeville.Hats--Pennsylvania--Monroeville.Musicians--Pennsylvania--Monroeville.Thomas, Alberta.
